item.title: What Does the Challenge Button Do in Silksong?
item.description:
Hollow Knight: Silksong drops the player in the Kingdom of Pharloom , where Hornet is the main protagonist. Even though the base gameplay features are all there from Team Cherry's previous hit game Hollow Knight , the combat and platforming in Silksong have much more depth and are also more enjoyable.

Hornet has a number of attacks and skills that she can perform along with a " Challenge " button. After trying this out for the first time, players might be confused about what it actually does. This is where the guide below will help you.

What Does the Challenge Button Do in Silksong?

The " Challenge " button in Silksong essentially performs a taunt action . This means that using it will aggro all enemies that are in proximity to you . This is a niche skill in Hornet's arsenal that players will not have a use for the majority of the time, given the inherent risk of drawing enemies closer. However, since the game features numerous platforming sections, some of which harbor flying enemies that can be quite annoying to deal with, the Challenge gesture becomes a valuable tool.

It allows you to bring these enemies that have not noticed you closer, allowing you to deal with them with ease and turn a frustrating encounter into a simple one. This adds a strategic layer to difficult platforming areas, allowing for more controlled engagements.

If you have Silk on you, the action will consume a small amount of your Silk, and the animation changes slightly as silk threads appear around Hornet, similar to when you use Silk to heal Hornet.

How to Perform the Challenge Gesture in Silksong?

To perform this gesture, you will need to press the R3 or Right Stick on your controller , or the V key if you are playing on a keyboard. If you go to the control scheme of a controller, you will not find "Challenge" mentioned, but it is still there. If you do not want to use the button, you can always assign the key to a different useful action that you have more use for.

Players interested in learning how to fast travel in Silksong can refer to the guide here.

item.title: The Perfect Content for Marvel Rivals’ Leaked Halloween Event is Sitting Right Under Players’ Noses
item.description:
Marvel Rivals is outdoing itself with each new season looking as or more spectacular than the last, as well as stunningly managing to continuously conceive incredible thematic concepts revolving around the two new characters it features. Marvel Rivals Season 4, launching on September 12, is notably captivating since it debuts two characters to its roster that would seem like opposites if not for the game’s original lore giving players more to chew on: Season 4.0’s Angela, a relatively obscure character with an interesting history in Marvel, and Season 4.5’s Daredevil, though he’s a far cry from the blind lawyer of Hell’s Kitchen that fans are familiar with.

As always, Marvel Rivals aired a Dev Vision diary recently to discuss its upcoming season, Heart of the Dragon, and inform players about the adjustments and overhauls that will be made, alongside any new features it may introduce. And, while there is a lot to unpack from what was detailed, creative director Guangguang and lead combat designer Zhiyong didn’t zero in on it, but a Halloween event tease, as per a so-called tab at the top of the menu screen, was seen in gameplay footage shown. As for what it could entail, one collaboration/inspiration seems like a no-brainer: Marvel Zombies .

Marvel Zombies is Having Its Heyday, and Marvel Rivals Should Participate This Halloween

Marvel Zombies may not be the most well-known comic book run—at least in terms of fans who’ve actually read the run versus fans who’ve heard of it or believe they know the general premise—but it’s not difficult to comprehend the idea of Marvel characters becoming afflicted with an infection that turns them into the living dead. In fact, the face-value shock factor of zombified Marvel characters is perhaps the whole appeal to Marvel Zombies , as fans get to witness what the likes of Spider-Man, Iron Man, and Wolverine are like as the undead, though their intellect, powers, and personality are preserved.

It’s a bit of an odd storyline that requires even more disbelief suspension than any ordinarily fantastical superhero comic book might, but the basic concept is no less engaging, particularly due to how it leans into body horror and lends itself to mature themes.

Marvel Zombies was unearthed from its restless grave for a mainstream appearance in Marvel’s What If…? ’s episode “What If… Zombies?!” on September 8, 2021, and is about to become far more popular than it’s ever been with a What If…? -esque miniseries devoted to Marvel Zombies is scheduled to be released on September 25 of this year—three weeks away at the time of this writing. So, with Marvel Rivals ’ Halloween event supposedly around the corner, too, no theme would be more fitting atmospherically for the spooky season.

A seasonal event might not be all-encompassing regarding which characters are selected to receive zombified skins, but there is at least one roster member who’s likely already been written out, as Doctor Strange already boasts a Doctor Strange in the Multiverse of Madness skin, adapting ‘Zombie Strange’ from the MCU movie. It’s also this skin that would make a great argument for a Marvel Zombies Halloween event, potentially serving as a framework for other zombie skins.

Even if it’s only a handful of ghoulish and grisly character skins alongside a festive assortment of Marvel Rivals cosmetics, such as MVPs, emotes, moods, and sprays, Marvel Zombies is likely the scariest and most high-profile Marvel horror project and could provide fascinating costumes. Plus, if not every Marvel Rivals character receives a Marvel Zombies skin this year, that’d simply give fans something to look forward to next year as an annual ‘trick or treat’ event to look forward to.

item.title: Marvel Rivals Reveals Legendary Angela Skin
item.description:
Marvel Rivals has given players a fresh look at a new legendary costume for the hero Angela, who will be added to the title's ever-expanding roster with the launch of Season 4 on September 12. In addition to Angela, Marvel Rivals fans can look forward to playing the iconic hero Daredevil later on in Season 4.

NetEase Games recently revealed that Marvel Rivals will be coming to PlayStation 4 alongside the launch of Season 4, bringing the popular hero shooter to a whole new audience. Rumors about a possible PlayStation 4 port have been swirling around the internet for quite some time, with many fans hopeful that they would soon be able to experience the title for themselves. Some gamers have expressed the desire to see the hero shooter come to other platforms as well, like the Xbox One and Nintendo Switch 2. As of writing, there hasn't been any official word about additional ports.

Marvel Rivals’ Angela Is Getting a 2099 Makeover

In a recent post on Twitter, NetEase Games gave players a closer look at what they can expect to see when Marvel Rivals ' Season 4 update goes live on September 12. In addition to releasing the new hero Angela, who will fill the role of Vanguard, players will be treated to fresh cosmetics in both the battle pass and the in-game store. Perhaps most notably, Angela will be receiving a new legendary costume called Skuld 2099. The outfit gives Angela a futuristic appearance, with a visor covering a large portion of her face. In addition to sporting some technology, Angela can be seen with white and purple hair, a color scheme that bleeds into her overall aesthetic.

In addition to adding Angela to the popular hero shooter, NetEase Games has announced that it will be adding Daredevil to the title's roster later on in Season 4. While many fans were excited to hear about the addition of the iconic street-level hero, some people were disappointed with his reveal. From what can be seen, Marvel Rivals ' version of Daredevil might embrace the mystical side of the setting's lore, which would be very different from how he has been portrayed in other films and television shows.

While NetEase Games has announced that it could bring original characters into Marvel Rivals , some fans disagree with how many liberties it seems to be taking with existing heroes like Daredevil. However, some fans are remaining cautiously optimistic, as it's likely players will learn more about Daredevil in the coming days and weeks ahead. With so much content to enjoy and a whole new season on the way, many gamers are feeling optimistic about the future of Marvel Rivals .

item.title: New Litten Pokemon Build-a-Bear Revealed
item.description:
Pokemon Sun and Moon fans who love Litten will want to get ready, as Build-a-Bear is releasing a plush based on the popular starter. Fans won't have to wait long to get their hands on the newest in the Pokemon Build-a-Bear line.

The Pokemon and Build-a-Bear collaborations have been going strong for nearly a decade. The first Pokemon revealed for the collection, as one might expect, was Pikachu, followed by Pokemon Let's Go starter Eevee, and the line gradually expanded from there, introducing more popular pocket monsters to the list. 2025 has already seen several Pokemon Build-a-Bears announced or released, including Yamper, Wooloo, Wooper, and a Jumbo Gengar.

Pokemon Build-a-Bear Announces Newest Creation

Now, the collection is introducing Litten, the fire starter from Pokemon Sun and Moon . A listing for the Pokemon is now on the Build-a-Bear website, but isn't available for purchase yet. Interested buyers can sign up to be notified when it goes on sale, or they can check back manually on September 18, when it's added to the store. Build-a-Bear is likely anticipating considerable demand for this plush, so big Litten fans shouldn't hesitate to secure one while they have the chance.

At the moment, Build-a-Bear has only teased a partial image of the Pokemon plush, but it gives a general idea of what to expect. Litten stands on four feet, with a raised tail, and its usual dour expression. The Pokemon appears to be wearing a coat or pajama outfit that's covered in an orange and yellow geometrical pattern with Poke Ball logos, similar to those that have come with other Pokemon Build-a-Bears. While not explicitly stated on the website at the time of publication, if Litten follows the usual Build-a-Bear pattern, buyers can expect it to arrive with the outfit it's shown wearing. Pokemon Build-a-Bear plush bundles also typically ship with a 5-in-1 sound chip, which plays five random voice clips of the Pokemon.

While the price for this Pokemon Build-a-Bear hasn't been announced yet, other standard-size Pokemon Build-a-Bear bundles that are currently available range in price from $60 to $75, so it's likely Litten will fall in that range. Those who are hoping for other Pokemon Sun and Moon starters to join the line should stay tuned. If Litten sells well, there's a good chance that its fellow starters Rowlet and Popplio will be produced at some point in the future. However, Build-a-Bear doesn't tend to stick to strict patterns when releasing the plushes, so it may be a while before those two appear.

item.title: Upcoming Steam VR Headset’s Name Potentially Revealed
item.description:
Valve ’s new VR headset, currently codenamed “Deckard,” may have had its official market name revealed: Steam Frame. Though it hasn’t been formally announced, a new trademark by Valve for the Steam Frame suggests it could be the name used by this upcoming virtual reality peripheral.

A new VR headset is being developed by Valve. Known as “Deckard” at the moment, this piece of hardware is a standalone, high-quality wireless VR headset that will feature compatibility with both Steam and the Steam Deck, and will be a successor to the Valve Index VR headset released in 2019. Despite the hype, little information has been officially shared by Valve, with most details available from leaks, insiders, and other sources.

Valve's 'Deckard' VR Headset Could Be Called 'Steam Frame'

Now, yet another piece of potential information has come from an unexpected source. Valve recently filed a new trademark for “Steam Frame,” which is “intended to cover the categories of computer hardware; computer networking hardware; computer peripherals; computer hardware and computer software for the reproduction, processing, and streaming of audio, video, data, text, and multimedia content.” While there has not been an official announcement confirming the fact, the mark’s wide coverage of both hardware and software sounds like it would cover everything the “Deckard” VR headset would need to do as a multimedia streaming device with full integration with the popular video game service platform.

Were that not convincing enough, recent strings discovered in the recent SteamVR update made dozens of references to the words “Frame” and “Steam Frame,” further suggesting the connection between the new Valve trademark and the VR headset. Valve insider Brad Lynch shared evidence of these changes and shared them on Twitter.

Lynch claims Valve’s plans go even deeper than that. While datamining, he discovered a mass rebranding of VR “overlays” to “frames,” with a major focus on what he referred to as “spatial gaming.” While Valve has yet to comment on this new trademark or information, it seems likely that the official name of the “Deckard” is going to be Steam Frame. That said, others suspect Steam Frame may be the name of Valve's new home console, so until gamers get word directly from the company, these details are still in the realm of speculation.

Regardless, evidence suggests Valve plans to release the “Deckard” before the end of 2025, with many suspecting November as the most likely release window. This would put it right before the holiday season, making it an ideal time to launch the new device – especially if the rumored $1200 price for the Valve peripheral is accurate. Considering this new trademark filing, an announcement for Steam’s upcoming VR headset could be imminent. Fans interested in finding out the official name, price point, and details should be sure to keep an eye on Valve in the meantime.
